message.content:
We first extract the needed end‐of‐period values from the three statements. For the balance sheet we have:

• Current Liabilities = 3,389,719.66  
• Owner’s Equity (end) = 16,111,731.83  
• Total Assets (end) = 19,501,451.49  
• Current Assets = 9,122,854.19  
 – Inventory = 7,869,940.00  
 – (The “quick” part of current assets is the rest.)  
• Accounts Receivable = 248,540.09  
• Cash on Hand = 927,447.32  
• Bank Deposits = 71,662.08  
• Interest Receivable = 5,264.70  

For the income statement:  
• Main Business Revenue = 791,992.51  
• Net Profit = 111,731.83  

For the cash flow statement:  
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –4,504,752.68  

Also, we note that the beginning balances (at 2023‑12‑31) for some items are given as follows:  
• Total Assets = 16,000,000.00  
• Owner’s Equity = 16,000,000.00  
• Accounts Receivable = 0 (so average AR = ending / 2)

We now calculate each ratio step‐by‐step.

1. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
   = Operating Cash Flow / Current Liabilities  
   = (–4,504,752.68) / 3,389,719.66  
   ≈ –1.33

2. Debt to Equity Ratio  
   The only liabilities shown equal Total Liabilities = Total Assets – Owner’s Equity  
   = 19,501,451.49 – 16,111,731.83 = 3,389,719.66  
   Hence,  
   = Total Liabilities / Owner’s Equity  
   = 3,389,719.66 / 16,111,731.83  
   ≈ 0.21

3. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
   To use an average total asset base we use:  
   Average Total Assets = (Beginning Total Assets + Ending Total Assets) / 2  
   = (16,000,000.00 + 19,501,451.49) / 2  
   = 35,501,451.49 / 2  
   ≈ 17,750,725.75  
   Then,  
   = Total Revenue / Average Total Assets  
   = 791,992.51 / 17,750,725.75  
   ≈ 0.0446, which we report as 0.04

4. Quick Ratio  
   Quick Assets include cash, bank deposits, accounts receivable, and (if considered liquid) interest receivable. Here,  
   Quick Assets = Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits + Accounts Receivable + Interest Receivable  
   = 927,447.32 + 71,662.08 + 248,540.09 + 5,264.70  
   = 999,109.40 (cash & equivalents) + 248,540.09 + 5,264.70  
   = 1,247,649.49 + 5,264.70  
   = 1,253,914.19  
   Then,  
   Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
   = 1,253,914.19 / 3,389,719.66  
   ≈ 0.37

5. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
   (Sometimes defined the same as the operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio.)  
   = –4,504,752.68 / 3,389,719.66  
   ≈ –1.33

6. Return on Equity (ROE)  
   We use net profit divided by average owner’s equity.  
   Average Owner’s Equity = (Beginning + Ending) / 2  
   = (16,000,000.00 + 16,111,731.83) / 2  
   = 32,111,731.83 / 2  
   ≈ 16,055,865.92  
   Then,  
   ROE = Net Profit / Average Owner’s Equity  
   = 111,731.83 / 16,055,865.92  
   ≈ 0.00696, or about 0.70%

7. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
   = Revenue / Average Accounts Receivable  
   Note: The beginning accounts receivable was 0. So, average AR = (0 + 248,540.09) / 2 = 124,270.045  
   Then,  
   = 791,992.51 / 124,270.045  
   ≈ 6.38

Now we present our answer in the requested JSON format.

{
  "solution": {
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-1.33",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.21",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.04",
    "Quick Ratio": "0.37",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-1.33",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "0.70%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "6.38"
  }
}
